ARABIC: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَّنثُورًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Ageless youths will circulate among them, serving them. Seeing them, you would think them scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And boys of everlasting youth will go about attending them. Looking at them you would think that they were pearls dispersed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: There boys of everlasting youth shall go about attending them: when you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will be served by immortal youths who look like scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Immortal youths shall surround them, waiting upon them; when you see them, you would think they are scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And round about them will (serve) boys of everlasting youth. If you see them, you would think them scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And round about them shall go youths never altering in age; when you see them you will think them to be scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Immortal youths shall go about them; when thou seest them, thou supposest them scattered pearls,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: There wait on them immortal youths, whom, when thou seest, thou wouldst take for scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They will be attended by youths who will not age -- when you see them you will think them to be like sprinkled pearls --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And there shall go round Unto them youths ever-young. When thou seest them thou wouldst deem them pearls unstrung.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They will be waited upon by immortal youths, whom, were you to see them, you will suppose them to be scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness): If thou seest them, thou wouldst think them scattered Pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And round about them will (serve) boys of everlasting youth. If you see them, you would think them scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Immortal youths will go about them, when you see them, you would suppose them to be scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Passing among them are eternalized youths. If you see them, you would think them sprinkled pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:19] And they will be waited upon by immortal youths, [immortally] in the form of youths, never ageing, whom, when you see them you will suppose them, because of their beauty and the way in which they are scattered about [offering] service, to be scattered pearls, [strewn] from their string, or from their shells, in which they are fairer than [when they, the pearls, are] otherwise [not in their shells].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: There wait on them youths of immortal youths) in Paradise who never die or are taken out of it; it is also said this means: youths wearing beautiful garments, (whom, when you see) Muhammad, (thou wouldst take for scattered pearls) because of their brightness; and it is also said this means: because of their scatteredness.
